section.title: Striping via Sparse Mapping
section.t: While other Layout Types support both dense and sparse mapping of logical offsets to phyisical offsets within a file (see for example Section 13.4 of ), the Flexible File Layout Type only supports a sparse mapping.

With sparse mappings, the logical offset within a file (L) is also the physical offset on the storage device. As detailed in Section 13.4.4 of , this results in holes across each storage device which does not contain the current stripe index.

figure.artwork:
L: logical offset into the file
W: stripe width W = number of elements in ffm_data_servers
S: number of bytes in a stripe S = W * ffl_stripe_unit
N: stripe number N = L / S
